com.hazelcast.nio

Class PacketIOHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.nio.PacketIOHelper

  • @PrivateApi
public class PacketIOHelper
extends Object
    Responsible for writing or reading an Packet. Originally the logic was placed in the Packet. The problem with this approach is that a single Packet instance can't be shared between multiple connections and this leads to increased memory usage since the packet needs to be copied for every connection. The PacketIOHelper is stateful because it tracks where the packet reading from ByteBuffer or writing to ByteBuffer. A PacketIOHelper instance should only be used for reading, or only be used for writing. So if you need to read and write at the same time, you need to have 2 instances. A PacketIOHelper is designed to be reused.

      Packet readFrom(ByteBuffer src)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PacketIOHelper

        public PacketIOHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • writeTo

        public boolean writeTo(Packet packet,
                       ByteBuffer dst)
        Writes the packet data to the supplied ByteBuffer, up to the buffer's limit. If it returns false, it should be called again to write the remaining data.
        Parameters:
        dst - the destination byte buffer
        Returns:
        true if all the packet's data is now written out; false otherwise.

      • readFrom

        public Packet readFrom(ByteBuffer src)
        Reads the packet data from the supplied ByteBuffer. The buffer may not contain the complete packet. If this method returns false, it should be called again to read more packet data.
        Parameters:
        src - the source byte buffer
        Returns:
        the read Packet if all the packet's data is now read; null otherwise.
